skill.name: git-protocol
skill.description: Git protocol implementation patterns using gitoxide for Guts repository operations
skill.summary: Implement Git repository operations with pure Rust using gitoxide library
skill.author: AbdelStark

security_audit.summary: All static findings are false positives. Ed25519 is strong modern crypto (misclassified as weak). Backticks are markdown code fences, not shell execution. Git protocol operations are legitimate repository functionality. No malicious patterns detected.

content.value_statement: This skill provides implementation patterns for Git repository operations using the pure-Rust gitoxide library. It enables safe and efficient Git operations without external git binary dependencies.
actual_capabilities: Open and create Git repositories using gitoxide
Read and write Git objects (blobs, trees, commits, tags)
Implement Smart HTTP protocol endpoints for git-upload-pack and git-receive-pack
Manage Git references and refs with atomic operations
Extended commit handling with Ed25519 cryptographic signatures
limitations: This skill provides implementation patterns and documentation, not executable commands
Does not replace git CLI or provide direct git command execution
Requires gitoxide library integration into a Rust project
Not a standalone tool for end users

use_cases.title: Build Git-powered Applications
use_cases.description: Developers can use these patterns to build applications that interact with Git repositories using the pure-Rust gitoxide library instead of invoking the git CLI.
use_cases.target_user: Rust developers building version control tools

use_cases.title: Implement Git Hosting Services
use_cases.description: Create Git server functionality with custom protocol handlers for git-upload-pack and git-receive-pack operations.

use_cases.title: Extend Git with Cryptographic Verification
use_cases.description: Add Ed25519 signature verification to Git commits for enhanced integrity and authentication in custom Git workflows.
use_cases.target_user: Security-conscious teams requiring cryptographic commit verification

prompt_templates.title: Open a Repository
prompt_templates.prompt: How do I open an existing Git repository or create a new one using gitoxide in Rust? Show me the code pattern.
prompt_templates.scenario: Need to work with a Git repository programmatically

prompt_templates.title: Read Git Objects
prompt_templates.prompt: Write Rust code to read Git objects (commits, trees, blobs) using gitoxide and decode their contents.
prompt_templates.scenario: Need to inspect repository history or file contents

prompt_templates.title: Implement Git HTTP Protocol
prompt_templates.prompt: Create HTTP endpoints for git-upload-pack and git-receive-pack using axum and gitoxide for a Git server.

prompt_templates.title: Generate Packfiles

prompt_templates.scenario: Need to implement Git clone or fetch functionality

output_examples.input: How do I create a new commit with gitoxide?
output_examples.output: Use the CommitBuilder pattern shown in the skill. First create a CommitRef with tree, parents, author, committer, and message. Then call write_object on the repository to persist the commit and get its ObjectId.

Gitoxide is a pure-Rust implementation of Git. It provides high-level crates like gix for operations, gix-object for object types, gix-hash for hashing, gix-pack for pack files, and gix-transport for protocol handling.

best_practices: Use gitoxide's high-level gix crate for common Git operations instead of spawning git processes
Implement atomic reference updates using PreviousValue::MustExistAndMatch for safe concurrent operations
Verify Ed25519 signatures on commits when using cryptographic extensions for integrity
anti_patterns: Do not invoke git CLI commands when gitoxide provides equivalent functionality
Do not skip reference verification when accepting pushes
Do not expose raw packfile generation without proper authentication

faq.question: What is gitoxide?
faq.answer: Gitoxide is a pure-Rust implementation of Git that provides safe, efficient Git operations without depending on the git binary.

faq.question: Can this skill run git commands directly?
faq.answer: No. This skill provides implementation patterns and code examples for using gitoxide programmatically. It does not execute git commands.

faq.question: What is Ed25519 used for in this skill?
faq.answer: Ed25519 provides cryptographic signatures for commits, enabling verification of commit authenticity and integrity beyond standard Git hashes.

faq.question: What is the Smart HTTP protocol?
faq.answer: Smart HTTP is a Git protocol that uses HTTP POST requests for efficient clone, fetch, and push operations between clients and servers.

faq.question: How does packfile generation work?
faq.answer: Packfiles bundle Git objects efficiently for transfer. Gitoxide can generate packfiles containing specific objects based on want/have negotiation.

faq.question: Is this skill production-ready?
faq.answer: This skill provides patterns and examples. Production use requires proper integration, testing, and security review of the complete implementation.
